snippet: Saudi Arabia’s acting health minister said Monday that this year’s hajj had been free of Ebola and other contagious diseases because of measures taken by the kingdom.
abstract: Adel Faqih, Saudi Arabia's acting health minister, says this year's hajj has been free of Ebola and other contagious diseases like Middle East Respiratory Syndrome because of measures taken to protect more than two million Muslim pilgrims.
lead_paragraph: Saudi Arabia’s acting health minister said Monday that this year’s hajj had been free of Ebola and other contagious diseases because of measures taken by the kingdom.
